subject: Iditarod Trail Sled Dog Race (Alaska)
Dog Sledding
lead_paragraph: Kjetil Backen of Norway made it through heavy falling snow to be the first musher in the Iditarod Trail Sled Dog Race to reach the checkpoint at Nikolai, Alaska. Backen coasted into the checkpoint, 347 miles into the race, at 10:39 a.m. with 15 dogs. The veteran Gerry Willomitzer of Whitehorse, Yukon, was second to reach Nikolai, the first of many Native villages along the 1,100-mile trail to Nome. Willomitzer clocked in at 11:17 a.m. with 14 dogs. A race spokesman said the temperature in Nikolai was in the 30s, which “is too hot for the dogs to run in.”.
